result.execSummary:
The defendant Arnold J. Barta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample
No contact with victim
Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Restitution held open for 60 days, for amount to be determined. Hearing may be requested.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arnold J. Barta

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Arnold J. Barta in court with attorney Michael B Winter.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 8:39 am.  Victim Impact Statement Filed.  Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights filed. State gives plea agreement, plea to charge, withheld sentence 1 year, no contact with victim, Counseling, Restitution to be determined in 60 days & costs. Atty Winter agrees with plea agreement.  Def. agrees with plea agreement.  Def. understands charge & penalties.  Disorderly Conduct, no contest plea.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Def. understands elements. Atty Winter is satisfied. Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Stipulate to factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea & finds def. Guilty to Disorderly Conduct. State gives sentencing argument.  Atty Winter gives sentencing argument.  Def. makes statement.  Court accepts plea agreement & orders 
withheld sentence 1 year probation, No contact with victim (C.G.), Restitution held open for 60 days, Hearing may be requested, costs, DNA Sample & surcharge, No credit, If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Counseling deemed appropriate be agent.

Defendant Arnold J. Barta in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received.  Court reads charges with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.  Agreement reached.  Statement by DA.  Def will waive right to an atty and will enter plea.  Bond set  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
